result.execSummary:
The defendant James D Forbes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.
Level 2 sex offender treatment.
Submit DNA sample.

No contact with anyone <18 yrs old without Agent approval.
Defendant is allowed contact with his own children unless Agent feels it not appropriate.
Not allowed any hardware or software or devices to download or access the internet.  No passwords or e-mail accounts.  Any usage is subject to Agents approval.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for 3 days served.
Defendant can transfer to another county if accepted.

Defendant James D Forbes in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire reviewed.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Remarks by Atty. Parker and Atty. Froelich.    Court advises party of their rights, gives citizenship/deportation admonition, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Pre-sentence report requested and ordered along with psycho sexual evaluation to be forwarded to the Court.  Defense counsel psychosexual report to be filed under seal.  PSI report writer to have copy.  Bond continues.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Conditions:  May have supervised contact with his children only. No travel outside the state without prior court approval, no use or possession of any device that can access the Internet or context.
PTC - May 10, 2016 @9:30 am, hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant James D Forbes in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Froelich files Pre Lim waiver form.  Court reviews with DE,  accepts waiver and binds the matter over for trial.  
ARRAIGNMENT:
Atty Froelich enters NG plea on behalf of his client, waives reading, reserves jurisdictional objection and jury trial rights.  
MOTION FOR BOND MODIFICATION: 
Atty Froelich - DE wishes to have contact w/his children, requests unsupervised contact.  Requests signature bond.  DA Parker opposes signature bond, argues against unsupervised contact. 
Court will allow SUPERVISED contact with his children only.  Denies motion to modify bond to signature bond.  
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant James D Forbes in court with attorney Christopher T. Froelich.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Willing to waive time limits for preliminary hearing within 10 or 20 days.  Bond has been posted.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

no contact with anyone under age 18, except his own children with supervision & incidental contact, no travel outside the State without prior court approval, no use or possess of any device that can access Internet or can text except for work

No contact with anyone under age 18 except his own children with supervision and incidental contact.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.  No use or possession of any device that can access the internet or has texting capability except at work but not for internet.
